column1: Art Institute of Chicago////Awesome museum. We only had time and energy for the impressionists and would have gone back another day had it not been raining or if the museum had a covered entrance. It is immediately next to Millennium Park where 'The Bean' (Cloud Gate) and 'The Two Faces Statues' (The Crown Fountain) are located. The park is free
column2: open to the public and a stroll through makes a nice accompaniment to an hour or so in the museum.
